textos_fuente.text: About CGCS - CGCS Call us at (813) 645-9111 Home About CGCS Services Services Contractual Maintenance Agronomic Consulting Golf Course Management Outsourcing Outsourcing Frequently Asked Questions Testimonials News Contact Environmental Commitment Search Menu We Live, Eat & Breath Golf Course Maintenance Our Core Beliefs and Most Important Values Our philosophy… We believe that making your customers happy will increase revenues and ultimately create viability for your golf asset. Our mission is to provide our clients with the most advanced and proven golf maintenance techniques available. Our proprietary strategies along with our financial insight will maximize your clubs potential. CGCS has dedicated itself to achieving an optimum level of perfomance at each of our managed facilities. Our philosophy…We believe that making your customers happy will increase revenues and ultimately create viability for your golf asset. Our mission is to provide our clients with the most advanced and proven golf maintenance techniques available. Our proprietary strategies along with our financial insight will maximize your clubs potential. CGCS has dedicated itself to achieving an optimum level of perfomance at each of our managed facilities. Scott A. Zakany serves as President of CGCS and has been involved in the Golf Course industry for over 30 years with experience at over 300 golf facilities in three countries. Prior to his involvement with CGCS, Mr. Zakany was a co-founder of International Golf Maintenance in 1994 where he served as President of the world’s largest golf course maintenance company. Due to recent economic times, it’s imperative that golf courses operate more efficiently and effectively to ensure that they are meeting golfers and owner/operators expectations.To ensure that this is occurring at every facility we manage, CGCS has adopted a philosophy that has become the cornerstone of our success. Some of these strategies include but are not limited to: Agronomic innovation and effective employee recruiting and training Cost efficiencies associated with time management studies and precise chemical and fertilization strategies Optimal budget usage by leveraging national purchasing agreements and preferred pricing Regulatory compliance and environmental strategies to reduce water and pesticide applications Improved maintenance strategies to reflect current market trends and customer demand In addition, the principals of CGCS have owned and operated clubs for over 25 years and have succeeded during these tough economical times. Having the feel of ownership and the thorough understanding of what it takes to make a golf operation successful has guided the maintenance operation at every club that we maintain. A Successful Team Beats with One Heart William Stine CEO Chief Executive Officer William "Bill" Stine has over 35 years of golf course operations and acquisitions experience. Bill is responsible for the oversight and management company assets as well as managing the corporate affairs of Cypress Golf Management. As a Co-Founder and President of International Golf Maintenance Co. (IGM), and Meadowbrook Golf, Bill was instrumental in growing the company to become the third largest golf course operator in the U. S. With 105 courses and 5,000 employees, he grew IGM into the industry’s largest provider of third party golf course maintenance. Bill is a Past President and is a current Board Member of the National Golf Course Owners Association and was an original member of the “Golf 20/20” steering committee. CGCS John Fogel COO - PGA Class "A" John is responsible for the oversight and direction of all golf operations. John has been a Class “A” PGA Professional since 1997 and possesses 20 years of experience in the golf industry. Previously, John worked with Kitson and Partners as Vice President of Operations. In his time there, John was responsible for the operations of all owned assets as well as all third party management contracts. John’s management assignments took him all across the United States including Hawaii, the North East, South East and South West. John also worked at Meadowbrook Golf and ascended to the position of Regional Vice President responsible for all operations at clubs in the North East and South East Regions. CGCS Scott A. Zakany President - Head Agronomist Scott A. Zakany heads the Agronomic Support team for Cypress Golf Management. Mr. Zakany has been involved in the Golf Course industry for over 40 years and has experience at over 300 golf facilities in three countries. Mr. Zakany is a member of the Top Agronomic Officers Advisory Board that works in conjunction with the National Golf Course Owner’s Association and he also serves as the Agronomic Counsel for the Golf Course Business Consultants Group (CGBC) which is a professional organization that provides owners and operators with golf course related services and advice. Mr. Zakany has an Associate of Science Degree in Golf Course Operation from LCCC and is an active member of several advisory groups and organizations. CGCS Cypress Golf Management’s key personnel have been involved in golf management throughout all areas of the United States. The senior management team averages over 40 years of experience in the golf operations industry. This team of operating professionals have operated and managed more than 115 public, resort and private golf facilities across different golf management companies in the United States. This experience translates to the understanding of what it takes to provide professional golf operations management. As current owners and operators of golf facilities ourselves, we understand the need to maximize profits and stabilize operations. However, our approach is always focused to a specific club and the game of golf itself. The values of which golf has been built on, are the values we use everyday to always exceed our guest’s experience and in accomplishing that goal the golf business side of the equation always falls into place. Interesting links Here are some interesting links for you! Enjoy your stay :) Apollo Beach Cypress Golf Course Services 235 Apollo Beach Blvd, #422 Apollo Beach, FL. 33572 (813) 645-9111 szakany@cgcs.com Orlando Cypress Golf Course Services 1118 Massachusetts Ave. Unit 1 St. Cloud, FL. 34769 John@cypressgolfmanagement.com Copyright 2016 Cypress Golf Course Services Scroll to top

Golf - Cypress Run Golf Club Call Us Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact MENU Member Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact Welcome to Cypress Run Golf Club – a haven for golf enthusiasts seeking more than just a picturesque course designed by the renowned architect, Larry Packard. Our journey began in 1981 as a dream nurtured by a deep passion for the game. We envisioned a serene, exclusive golf club, and that dream has transformed into a remarkable reality. Cypress Run Golf Club boasts a championship 18-hole golf course thoughtfully designed with five sets of tees, catering to players of all skill levels. It can be as short as 5,372 yards or as challenging as 7,001 yards. With meticulously maintained tif-eagle greens, we proudly uphold our reputation as the most meticulously manicured and enjoyable golf club in the Tampa Bay area. But Cypress Run is more than just a golfing paradise. Our club is a sanctuary for those who appreciate the finer things in life. Beyond the fairways, you'll discover a delightful outdoor fire-pit, a welcoming lounge, a grill room, and a full-scale dining facility that offers both exquisite fine dining and relaxed, casual fare. Our dedicated staff, who exude warmth and professionalism, meticulously organize golf and social events, ensure that our Members and their guests feel truly accommodated and valued. Join us at Cypress Run Golf Club, where we combine the best in golf with exceptional amenities and a warm, welcoming community. Cypress Run Golf Club 2669 St Andrews Blvd Tarpon Springs, FL 34688 Phone: (727) 938-3774 Pro Shop: (727) 937-3191 Grille Room: (727) 888-3078 steve.martin@cypressrun.com © Cypress Run Golf Run. All Rights Reserved

First time Login Instructions Username : your member number - for example your member number - FG111 Note:  If you are a Spouse or Significant Other of a Primary Member - you need to place "A" at the end of your member number.  For example if your Primary Member's number is FG111, you need to enter FG111A as your username. Password : your last name - for example, smith * You will be prompted to update your username and/or password after logging in. Employment | Join the Team at Cypress Mountain | Cypress Mountain Skip to main content Cypress Mountain Tickets, Lessons & Rentals Things to Do Plan & Discover Mountain Safety Open conditions trails menu Loading... Open or Close main menu Home Home Employment EMPLOYMENT Vancouver's Biggest Ski Resort Join a team dedicated to creating an exceptional recreational experience all year round at Vancouver's biggest mountain. Whether you ski, snowboard, or neither, there's a place for you at Cypress Mountain. With 26 departments and over 100 roles, we have something for everyone. Enjoy competitive pay, amazing perks, a stunning work environment, and a community of like-minded individuals. Explore the opportunities and become part of our team today! Work where you love to play We are currently hiring for winter seasonal positions and some exciting full-time/year-round career opportunities. Apply now! Apply Now Featured Positions Open all Accounting - Accounts Payable Clerk (Full Time/Year Round) If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy problem-solving, and have a passion for working with numbers, this position is for you! Join the Cypress Mountain Accounting Team as the Accounts Payable Clerk. In this role, you’ll play a key part in keeping our operations running smoothly by handling a variety of accounting and bookkeeping tasks, including processing invoices, payment of vendors, maintaining accurate financial records, preparing reports, performing account reconciliations, and supporting day-to-day financial operations. Click HERE for a full job description. Electrical - Apprentice (Full Time/Year Round) Our Electrical Department is excited to welcome a new team member who is beginning their electrical trade journey! As part of the Operations Team, electrical apprentices play an important role in supporting the installation, maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting of key infrastructure across the mountain. This includes power distribution, lift systems, snowmaking equipment, buildings, and other essential utilities. This is a hands-on opportunity to learn from experienced professionals while gaining valuable skills in a dynamic and unique mountain environment. Click HERE for a full job description. F&B - Head Chef (Full Time/Year Round) If you’re passionate about the Food & Beverage industry, thrive in a high-energy/fast paced kitchen environment, and are a natural leader, this is the role for you! As Head Chef and a key member of our Food & Beverage Management Team, you will oversee the entire culinary process - from menu conceptualization to implementation, across all kitchen lines, with a focus on delivering outstanding dining experiences. Core responsibilities include food costing, plating and presentation, packaging, and training team members in all aspects of cooking and service. You’ll also have the opportunity to create special event menus, bring fresh ideas to life, and collaborate with a passionate F&B team dedicated to excellence. We’re looking for someone who thinks big and leads by example. Someone who can mentor, inspire, and support their team while working hands-on to elevate every guest experience. Click HERE for a full job description. Lift Operations - Team Lead (Winter Seasonal) The Lift Operations Team Lead plays a key role in the day-to-day operation of our six Downhill chairlifts throughout both the winter and summer seasons. Working closely with Supervisors, Managers, and the Lift Maintenance Team, this hands-on leader sets the standard for exceptional guest service, supports Lift Attendants in their daily duties, and ensures all lift operations run safely, efficiently, and in line with established procedures. This fully outdoor role requires intermediate to advanced skiing or snowboarding ability and is perfect for someone who enjoys leading a dynamic team while working across the entire Downhill Area. Click HERE for a full job description. Lift Operations - Supervisor (Winter Seasonal) A Lift Operations Supervisor assists with the oversight and daily operation of our 6 Downhill chairlifts during both winter and summer operations, working closely with the Lift Operations Manager, Assistant Manager, and the Lift Maintenance Team. This hands-on leadership role sets the standard for exceptional customer service, efficient lift operations, adherence to safety polices and supports Lift Attendants in their daily duties, including snow removal, maze setup, and guest service. The Supervisor is also responsible for auditing lift locations, ensuring team members receive proper training, scheduling and approving payroll, and supporting staff development. In addition, this role participates in hiring new team members and assists with lift startups, operations, and maintenance activities as required. Click HERE for a full job description. Rentals - Shift Supervisor (Full Time/Extended Season) Rentals Shift Supervisors oversee the fast-paced Downhill Rentals area, ensuring smooth, efficient, and guest-focused operations. This hands-on leadership role manages daily workflows, supports and motivates team members, and maintains the highest standards in ski and snowboard rentals. Combining technical know-how with strong people skills, the Rentals Shift Supervisors keep the shop running seamlessly while driving satisfaction for both guests and team members. Click HERE for a full job description. Rentals/Repairs - Senior Repairs Supervisor (Full Time/Extended Season) The Senior Repairs Supervisor oversees the daily operations of the high-volume ski repair shop, featuring a state-of-the-art Jupiter robotic tuning machine. This hands-on leadership role ensures top-quality ski and snowboard tuning, repair, and maintenance while guiding a team of technicians, optimizing workflows, and upholding the highest standard of guest satisfaction. Combining technical expertise with strong operational oversight, the Senior Repairs Supervisor drives efficiency, and maintains the shop’s reputation for excellence. Click HERE for a full job description. Snowmaking - Snowmaker (Full Time/Extended Season) Snowmaking Team members work as part of a team within the Operations department under the direction of the Snowmaking Supervisors and Snowmaking Manager. They make rounds in vehicles and/or snowmobiles to monitor quality control and weather conditions during snowmaking cycles. They work outside in all weather conditions and shift work is required *some shifts may be on an on-call basis, contingent on weather conditions/snowmaking windows. Click HERE for a full job description. Snow School - Development Lead (Winter Seasonal) The Cypress Snow School is seeking a professional, collaborative, and inspiring leader to join our team in a unique hybrid role that combines on-snow instruction, team mentorship, and program development. This exciting opportunity balances lesson delivery with instructor training and team development, while fostering a positive and inclusive culture of growth. As a key connection between the Snow School leadership team and our instructors, this role provides ongoing support, drives training initiatives, and helps strengthen our culture of continuous learning and professional development. If you’re ready to make a meaningful impact, demonstrate your leadership skills, and grow alongside a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply. Click HERE for a full job description. Snow School - Evening Program Supervisor (Winter Seasonal) At Cypress Mountain, exceptional guest service and a supportive team culture are at the heart of everything we do. Our Evening Program Supervisors play a vital role in bringing this to life, ensuring our evening guests and team members have a safe, fun, and memorable experience. In this role, you’ll take the lead on Snow School operations during evening programs, working closely with Management to support and mentor instructors, oversee lessons, and keep the program running smoothly. You’ll foster teamwork, provide guidance, and empower your team to deliver the experience of a lifetime under the lights. This is your opportunity to lead with care, inspire excellence, and help create lasting memories for everyone who joins our Snow School evenings. Click HERE for a full job description. Snow School - Ski/Snowboard Instructor (Winter Seasonal) Cypress Mountain is now hiring instructors for the 2025/26 winter season. Join the Cypress Mountain Snow School and get paid to share your love of snow with others and ski or ride all winter long! Click HERE for a full job description. Snow School - Supervisor (Winter Seasonal) At Cypress Mountain, exceptional guest service and a supportive team culture are at the heart of everything we do. Our Snow School Supervisors are key to bringing this to life, shaping unforgettable experiences for both guests and team members. In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with Management, leading the day-to-day operations of the Snow School with dedication and care. This includes mentoring instructors, fostering teamwork, and empowering the team to deliver the experience of a lifetime. It’s a chance to lead with compassion, inspire excellence, and help create lasting memories for everyone who comes through the Cypress Mountain Snow School. Click HERE for a full job description. Free Mountain Shuttle Get a complimentary Team Member bus pass, valued at $2000+. View Shuttle 50% Off Food & Beverage Receive a 50% discount in the Hollyburn Lodge, Gold Medal Café, Cypress Creek Grill, The Patio & Nordic Café. View Dining Free Ski or Board Lessons Learn how to Ski, Snowboard or Cross Country Ski! View Downhill Lessons View Cross Country Lessons Retail  Discounts Up to 40% off in our on-mountain retail store. Plus, participating local businesses can receive discounts through the Flash Your Pass program. Big Bear Sports Flash Your Pass Day & Seasonal Rental Discount Discount on Alpine and Nordic rentals. Plus, a staff special on Seasonal Rentals! View Rentals Free Skiing at Sister Resorts Team members receive three FREE days of skiing at each of Boyne Resorts' nine mountain destinations. View Boyne Resorts Reciprocal Discounts Team members are entitled to 50% off the lead ticket price at all Ikon Pass partner resorts. View Ikon Partner Resorts © Boyne Resorts 2025

About Us - Cypress Lakes Link to Facebook Link to X Link to Mail Link to Rss  this site Call us at (256) 381-1232 Golf Course About Us Rates Membership Tournaments Tennis Club Calendar Contact Menu Menu About Us Cypress Lakes Golf Course Information Cypress Lakes offers an 18-hole, par 71, layout that is challenging and fun for all skill levels.  With five sets of tees available a good time can be had by all.  The tees, fairways, and rough are comprised of wonderfully manicured bermuda grass, while the putting surfaces feature the highly acclaimed mini verde ultra dwarf bermuda grass.  Our goal is to offer you the best possible playing surfaces year round so that you feel you are given the best chance to play your best. With numerous dog legs and water hazards throughout the course, your tee shots are of utmost importance during your round.  This will obviously give you your best chance to score well and leave with a smile on your face. Here is a quick recap of each hole here at Cypress Lakes. Front Nine Hole 1 Par 4 A short opening hole, it offers you a good chance at par or better.  A 200 yard shot off the tee will leave you with a short iron over water into this green.  Be aware of the out of bounds down the left side. Only roughly a 280 yard carry from the white tee allows you to be brave with the first shot of the day. Beware of the Muscle Shoals area winds though! Hole 2 Par 4 A tee shot down the middle or to the left side of this fairway is preferred.  Anything down the right side could find the water lining this fairway.  A mid to short iron into this green which slopes from back to front is preferred. Hole 3 Par 4 This is a sharp dog leg right that big hitters can cut the corner and leave themselves a short iron to this green.  However, you have to be careful of the bunker down the left side of this fairway.  A relatively flat green awaits approach shots. Hole 4 Par 5 This straight away hole offers a good chance at birdie that the long hitters may reach in two.  Make sure your aim off the tee is true and watch out for the fairway bunker on the right.  The green is at a slight angle away from the fairway that can make your approach shot trickier than it looks. Hole 5 Par 3 A short par 3 where you will only need a short iron to this undulated green.  Hitting the green will probably not be difficult, but the fun begins when the putter is in your hand. (NEW IN SPRING 2025… A NEWLY REDISGNED LARGER TEE COMPLEX) Hole 6 Par 5 Another reachable par 5 for the long hitters, you must hit the fairway to have any chance at going for it as trees line both the left and right side of the fairway in the landing area.  The green is guarded short and right by water.  This means most players will opt to lay up with an iron and leave a short iron to this two tiered green. Hole 7 Par 3 Par is definitely a good score here.  A mid to long iron is needed for this long par 3 with an island green that many feel is the signature hole of the course.  The green is big but has many subtle undulations that will challenge you once you are on the putting surface. Hole 8 Par 4 This hole plays much narrower from the tee than it appears.  An iron or fairway wood is the prudent play off the tee down the right side as anything left of center has a chance at going in the water that lines the left of this fairway.  If you can find the fairway, a mid to short iron is all you need into this relatively large green. Hole 9 Par 4 The front nine finishes with this short par 4 giving you a good chance at birdie.  With out of bounds down the left, some players may try to drive this green which is guarded by bunkers, both left and right, short of this green.  Any tee shot just past the tree line on the corner will leave you with a short iron into this subtly undulated green. Back Nine Hole 10 Par 4 The back nine begins with a tee shot that must find the fairway.  With water left this is no easy task.  Once in the fairway you will find yourself with a mid to short iron that must be hit high to hold this green that slopes devilishly from front to back.  Take a par here and run. Hole 11 Par 4 This is a sharp dog leg left with out of bounds down the left side.  An iron or fairway club should be hit just around the corner, anymore could find the water or be blocked out by trees on the right side of the fairway.  This will leave you with a short iron into this receptive green with a good chance at birdie. Hole 12 Par 3 This short par 3 is all carry over water and the front bunker.  The green is relatively large for this short hole with subtle breaks and is sloped from back to front.  Leaving here with anything above par will leave you scratching your head. Hole 13 Par 4 Many feel this is the toughest par 4 of the course and it is the #1 handicap hole on the scorecard.  With out of bounds right, a tee shot must go long or left of the bunker at the corner of this dog leg right but water looms through the fairway as well.  The second shot is a short to mid iron to a long green guarded by water on the left and bunker on the right.  Par here is an excellent score. Hole 14 Par 5 This is predominantly a three shot par 5 with trouble looming.  A big oak tree guards the left side of the fairway.  Out of bounds is down the entire right side of this hole and your lay up shot must be left or short of water that is situated 75 yards from the green.  That water goes all the way up the right side and is lurking to the right of the green as well.  Birdies can be made here but par is a good score. Hole 15 Par 4 Big hitters may find themselves going for it on this short par 4.  However, trees dot the right hand side of this fairway and a bunker surround the front of this green.  Out of bounds right must also be taken into consideration.  The better play may be to lay back and hit a short iron into this undulated green for your best chance at birdie.  This is a good risk-reward hole. Hole 16 Par 4 This is another short par 4 with a lot of trouble waiting.  Water and out of bounds go down the right side of this hole and a one lone bunker frame this fairway down the left.  The green is relatively small and is guarded by a grass bunker which is the remains of the former six-foot deep pot bunker called the “Devil’s Pit”. Hole 17 Par 3 This is another long par 3 where par is definitely a good score.  The tee shot is all carry over water, with water guarding the left side of this large green as well.  The green slopes from back to front, and right to left.  Take a par and run. (NEW IN SUMMER 2024 A NEWLEY EXPANDED TEEING COMPLEX TO ALLOW FOR A SHORTER HOLE.) Don’t let that fool you though. This is a green that was a short par 4 green in its past life. Hole 18 Par 4 This slight dog leg left is a strong finishing hole.  Stay away from the tree on the left to find the fairway here.  This will leave you with a mid to short iron into a large green with a small bunker guarding the front.  You definitely want to be in the proper quadrant of this green to ensure yourself of at least a two-putt to finish your round. Privacy Policy - Cypress Point Country Club Skip to main content Skip to footer Cypress Point Country Club Virginia Beach, VA Home Tee Times Public Tee Times Member Tee Times Golf Course Details Scorecard Lessons Membership Pool Cypress Bar & Grill Contact Us Contact Us Employment Privacy Policy Join Our E-Club! Member Section Privacy Policy Privacy Notice This privacy notice discloses the privacy practices for cypresspointcc.com & the collection of Opt-In Cell Phone numbers. It will notify you of the following: What personally identifiable information is collected from you through the website, how it is used and with whom it may be shared. What choices are available to you regarding the use of your data. The security procedures in place to protect the misuse of your information. How you can correct any inaccuracies in the information. Information Collection, Use, and Sharing We are the sole owners of the information collected on this site. We only have access to/collect information that you voluntarily give us via email or other direct contact from you. We will not sell or rent this information to anyone. We will use your information to respond to you, regarding the reason you contacted us. We will not share your information with any third party outside of our organization, other than as necessary to fulfill your request, e.g. to ship an order. Unless you ask us not to, we may contact you via email in the future to tell you about specials, new products or services, or changes to this privacy policy. We use SimpleTexting to send out any text messaging alerts. Their Privacy Policy can be found here: https://simpletexting.com/privacy-policy/ We will only text you if you have opted in to our messaging options, which your are able to opt out of by texting STOP. We partner with another party to provide specific services. When the user signs up for these services, we will share names, or other contact information that is necessary for the third party to provide these services. These parties are not allowed to use personally identifiable information except for the purpose of providing these services. Your Access to and Control Over Information You may opt out of any future contacts from us at any time. You can do the following at any time by contacting us via the email address or phone number given on our website: See what data we have about you, if any. Change/correct any data we have about you. Have us delete any data we have about you. Express any concern you have about our use of your data. Security Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job (for example, billing or customer service) are granted access to personally identifiable information. The computers/servers in which we store personally identifiable information are kept in a secure environment. If you feel that we are not abiding by this privacy policy, you should contact us immediately via telephone at 757-490-6300 or receptionist@cypresspointcc.com . ABOUT US | Cypress Creek Golfers' Club, Smithfield, VA top of page Get Our Mobile App! Download Now > Smithfield, VA BOOK TEE TIME MEMBER PORTAL ABOUT US COURSE DINING BOOK A LESSON CCGC CRITTERS EVENTS CALENDAR MEMBERSHIPS MORE Use tab to navigate through the menu items. About Us Cypress Creek Golfers' Club was carefully carved from the mature hardwood forests and centuries old peanut fields of Smithfield. The peacefully secluded setting is the ideal environment for a round of golf and the challenging design will have you using every club in your bag. The golf course will reward creative shot-making and thoughtful strategy but it is not overly punishing for the high handicapper. The rolling terrain provides plenty of challenging ups and downs throughout and there are many water holes, including the memorable ninth, a short par 4 with an island green. Cypress Creek Golfers’ Club even has its own “amen corner” that starts with the par-4 15th, moves on to the waterlogged 16th, and finishes with another par 4, an uphill hole that is the toughest of the trio. ​ TOUR OUR COURSE Location 600 Cypress Creek Parkway Smithfield VA, 23430 Contact Us 757-365-4774 Golf@CCGCSmithfield.com ©2025 Cypress Creek Golfers' Club Join Our Team! Cypress Lake Golf Club –  Est 1959 Memberships Brian Hart, PGA, Membership Director 239-481-1333 419-688-9398 brian@cypresslakegc.com Golf Memberships: Equity Golf: Founder Membership $35,000 stock purchase  –  $12,600 family dues/$8,400 single dues  –  $2,400 capital dues  – $600 food & beverage minimum. Founder Membership is available to an individual or jointly to a married couple and dependent children under the age of 24. As the nucleus of the Club, each Founder Membership will share in ownership of the Club, can vote on affairs of the Club and hold elected office. Founder members have year round use of the clubhouse, golf course, practice facilities, tennis facilities and dining rooms. Sports Memberships: Sports Membership:   – $2,520 (family) dues / $1,680 (single) dues  –  $600 capital dues  –  $100 food & beverage minimum  No stock certificate purchase. Sports Membership is available to an individual or jointly to a married couple and dependent children under the age of 24. Sports members have year round use of tennis facilities, clubhouse and dining rooms. The Club extends Sports members summer golf privileges May through October with payment of appropriate fees. Can be upgraded to a Founder Membership at the then current price, provided a membership is available. Interested? Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form. Membership - Cypress Run Golf Club Call Us Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact MENU Member Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact Membership Membership Information From the layout of the property to the attitude of the membership, love of the game is paramount. At Cypress Run Golf Club, our commitment to the love of the game is not just a philosophy – it's the very essence of who we are. Our meticulously designed course is a testament to our dedication to golf in all its forms. With every golfer in mind, we've crafted a course that accommodates every level of ability. From the championship tees, the course stretches to an impressive 7,001 yards, setting the stage for tournament-level play. For those who seek a slightly gentler challenge, our forward tees bring the course's length to a more approachable 5,372 yards without sacrificing the essence of the game. We also have a Toptracer Driving Range where you can do everything from work on your game to bring your game to a new level or play a casual round of virtual golf on iconic golf courses such as Pebble Beach and St. Andrews. Whether you're a seasoned pro or a newcomer to the sport, our course and facilities offer an experience tailored to your skill and enjoyment. Join us at Cypress Run Golf Club, where the love of the game thrives at every tee. Full Golf Membership Limited Availability Full Golf Members are extended Full Privileges of the Golf Course, Toptracer Range and Clubhouse. Full Golf Members are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. Full Golf Membership is offered in both Single and Family Plans. Family Plans included Spouse or significant other and all children residing in the home 23 years of age and under. Full Golf Members may make tee times up to fourteen (14) days in advance. Full Golf Members may host guests and pay the customary Guest of Member rate Young Associate Membership Limited Availability to those that are 40 and under years of age. Young Associate Golf Members are extended Full Privileges of the Golf Course, Toptracer Range and Clubhouse. Young Associate Members are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. The Young Associate Golf Membership is offered in both Single and Family Plans. Family Plans included Spouse or significant other and all children residing in the home 23 years of age and under. Young Associate Golf Members may make tee times up to fourteen (14) days in advance. Young Associate Members may host guests and pay the customary Guest of Member rate Executive Golf Membership Limited Availability Executive Members have unlimited use of the Golf Course, Toptracer Range and Clubhouse. Executive Members are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. The Executive Membership is an Individual Membership that includes family Clubhouse access. Executive Members may make tee times up to seven (7) days in advance. Executive Members will be charged the Executive Rate which includes Green Fees and Cart Fees. Executive Members may host guests and pay the customary Guest of Member rate. Executive Members may play in a limited number of Club Plaque Events at the Executive rate. Social Membership Limited Availability Social Members are extended unlimited use of the Clubhouse. Social memberships are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. Social Members may play golf three times a calendar year at the customary Guest of member rate. Tennis & Pickleball Social Membership Limited Availability Tennis Members are Social Members and have unlimited use of the Tennis & Pickleball Courts and Clubhouse. Tennis Members are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. The Tennis Membership is a Family Membership that includes family Clubhouse access. Tennis Members have limited access to the Toptracer range and Golf Course six times a year. Tennis Members may make court times up to seven (7) days in advance. Tennis Members may host guests and pay the customary Guest of Member rate. Pickleball Only with Social Membership option available Memberships do not have a Food and Beverage Minimum an d will not be charged Operating Assessments. Tennis & Pickelball - Cypress Run Golf Club Call Us Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact MENU Member Login Golf Course History Top Tracer The Golf Shop Practice Facilities Golf Course Designer Scorecard Course Tour Dining & Special Events Weddings Member Dining Membership What Members are Saying Awards Contact On Serve: A New Beginning of Tennis at Cypress Run Golf Club Discover the world of tennis at Cypress Run, where players of all ages and skill levels can embrace the game. Our dedicated instructors offer lessons tailored to your individual proficiency, whether you're looking to refine your technique or embark on a tennis journey. Currently, we proudly offer two versatile tennis courts that conveniently transform into four pickleball courts and four Har - Tru Courts with two of them being lit for evening play. Andrey Golubev, a world-ranked doubles tennis player, is the Tennis Director and is set to bring his team of expert coaches to Cypress Run Golf Club, making it the ultimate destination for tennis enthusiasts and leisurely matches with friends.Discover the multitude of affordable tennis memberships Cypress Run Golf Club has to offer. Ready to elevate your tennis game? Schedule private or group lessons with our experienced tennis professionals. Whether you're a novice or a seasoned player, our USPTA/PTR Professional Staff is at your service seven days a week. Join our tennis clinics or classes tailored to all ages and skill levels to enhance your game. Cypress Run Golf Club is committed to supporting USTA leagues and tournament play for its tennis club members and their guests. Feel free to contact our pro shop for more details or visit us in person. Pickleball at Cypress Run GOLF CLUB Are you ready to dive into the exciting world of Pickleball? This rapidly growing and exhilarating sport is easy to pick up, heaps of fun, and suitable for all ages! We provide access to four top-notch pickleball courts for outdoor play. Want to sharpen your skills or explore the game in-depth? Cypress Run offers a variety of classes, clinics, and lessons exclusively for our members. Tennis & Pickleball Membership Limited Availability Tennis Members are Social Members and have unlimited use of the Tennis & Pickleball Courts and Clubhouse. Tennis Members are subject to an Initiation Fee and Monthly Dues as published in the Club’s Fee Schedule. The Tennis Membership is a Family Membership that includes family Clubhouse access. Tennis Members have limited access to the Toptracer range and Golf Course six times a year. Tennis Members may make court times up to seven (7) days in advance. Tennis Members may host guests and pay the customary Guest of Member rate.
